name: World Writable Files or Folders (777)
description: Setting file or directory permissions to 777 allows any user full access. This is a serious security risk.

name: S3 Bucket with Public Read Access
description: S3 buckets with public-read ACL can expose sensitive data to anyone with the URL.

name: Weak JWT Secret
description: Using trivial secrets like '123' for JWT signing allows easy forgery of tokens.

name: Hardcoded OAuth Secret in Frontend
description: OAuth secrets should never be exposed in frontend code. Use server-side storage instead.

name: Exposed Internal Port in Frontend Code
description: Hardcoding internal ports in client code could leak internal service exposure risks.

name: Sensitive Certificate Files in Repos
description: Private key or certificate files should never be committed to public repositories.
